chapter.title: Getting Started With the OpenICF Framework and OpenICF Connectors
chapter.para: This chapter describes what is required before you begin to integrate an existing OpenICF connector into your Identity Management application.

procedure.para: Before you can use an OpenICF connector in your application, you must download the OpenICF framework bundles, and the required connector bundles, and add them to your CLASSPATH.
The easiest way to start a new OpenICF project is to use the sample Maven project file as a starting point. This sample project includes comprehensive comments about its use.

step.para: Download the OpenICF Connector Framework. If you are planning to use the PowerShell connector or the Active Directory connector, download the .NET Framework. For all other connectors, download the Java Framework from the ForgeRock Maven repository.
Add the following JAR files to your CLASSPATH:
Download the specific connector bundle or bundles that you want to use, from the OpenICF Connector Bundles page.
Add the connector bundle or bundles to your CLASSPATH.
You can now start integrating the connector with your application, as described in Implementing the OpenICF API.

note.para: If you are building a new connector by using one of the OpenICF Maven connector archetypes, you do not need to download the Connector Framework separately. The required Connector Framework JAR files are downloaded automatically, because the Maven project defines the framework as a dependency.

chapter.para: After you have set up your project, you must implement the OpenICF API to call the connector implementations from your application.
